alert.note: Alert for DeWitt (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 24 at 8:21PM CST until January 27 at 8:34PM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Guadalupe River Near Cuero affecting DeWitt County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Guadalupe River near Cuero. * WHEN...Until Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet, Flooding extends into floodplain above Cuero threatening livestock. US Hwy 183 North at Hochheim has water on or crossing the roadway. Highway likely closed. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 20.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 19.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 27.4 feet late tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 27.5 feet on 01/28/1992. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (9 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Guadalupe River Cuero 24.0 20.1 Wed 7 pm CST 27.4 26.1 19.9 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 830 AM CST.
